name: reprovingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that shows that you disapprove of someone's bad or silly behaviour: "That's a terrible habit," he said reprovingly. When she saw me getting up to leave, she slowly shook her head at me reprovingly.
More examplesFewer examplesHe frowned reprovingly when I suggested parking in a disabled parking space."That's absolutely unacceptable," he interrupted reprovingly when the presenter revealed the plans for the development.The teacher spoke reprovingly to the class about their poor behaviour.
